column21: Land not used for buildings in PUDs must be conserved. "Water supply and sewage disposal systems designed and installed to State Department of Health specifications may be required" (Marshfield Zoning Regulations, page 20). May =/= is.
column22: Frontage rules (for all dwellings): Lots <10 acres must have 250ft minimum frontage; Lots >10 acres must have 350 ft minimum frontage;

column21: Accessory *uses* are permitted, but I do not know if this applies to dwellings as the list of uses is: woodsheds, barns, stables, garages, and tool shed. Accessory structures may only be up to 100sqft but ADUs say only =<30%. Accessory dwellings are said to be generally permitted for existing structures earlier in Section 305, so perhaps they are permitted. PRDs are allowed.
column22: PRDs are permitted (minimum of 2 units at 10 acres per unit). Frontage for all permitted structures is 450ft.
column170: Parking Spaces Add'l to Main Unit

column21: They have rules for residential development but also say it's not permitted in the use table, and other Flood Hazard areas from other jurisdictions have tended to not permit residential development. Now, accessory *uses* are permitted, but I do not know if this applies to dwellings as the list of uses is: woodsheds, barns, stables, garages, and tool shed. Accessory structures may only be up to 100sqft but ADUs say only =<30%. Accessory dwellings are said to be generally permitted for existing structures earlier in Section 305, so perhaps they are permitted. This would be consistent with other flood hazard areas from other jurisdictions.
column170: Parking Spaces Add'l to Main Unit

column22: "Water supply and sewage disposal systems designed and installed to State Department of Health specifications may be required" (Marshfield Zoning Regulations, page 20).

column21: "Within the Water Conservation Overlay District, no land development and no clearing of land is permitted except as provided below" (page 51), no mention of dwellings being permitted/conditional use.
